info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 9:20AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF ROAN AND TAVAPUTS PLATEAUS...FLAT TOPS...GRAND AND BATTLEMENT MESAS...AND DEBEQUE TO SILT CORRIDOR COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 50 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 920 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 18 miles west of Rifle to Parachute to near De Beque to 9 miles northeast of Palisade and moving northeast at 45 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Parachute around 925 AM MST. Rifle around 945 AM MST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 71 and 92. Colorado 13 between mile markers 1 and 15. Colorado 65 between mile markers 54 and 57. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
